snippet: New passenger-car sales in Europe in the first eight months of this year were the lowest ever tracked for the period.
abstract: European Automobile Manufacturers Assn reports new passenger-car registrations fell 5 percent in August from year earlier, after 5 percent increase in July; sales in first eight months of 2013 were lowest ever tracked for the period.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: New passenger-car sales in Europe in the first eight months of this year were the lowest ever tracked for the period.

headline.main: Auto Sales in Europe Fall Again, but Tumble Is Thought to Be Ending
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales in Europe Fall Again, but Tumble Is Thought to Be Ending
